result.execSummary:
The defendant Santos Vera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santos Vera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Screnock Re: Cash Bond Ordered Forfeited

Case Called @ 2:29 PM:  Defendant Santos Vera in court with attorney Paul Steven Screnock.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Interpreter oath administered by the Court.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and consel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (OAR):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Def:  Yes - apologizes for missed Court date due to error in time of the hearing.  The Court:  Imposes Court Costs - previous bond forfeiture authorized to be reinstated and applied to Costs imposed - Balance to be paid within 60 Days.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

Case Recalled @ 4:00 PM:  Attorney Paul Steven Screnock in court.  Case recalled as counsel was able to reach his client.  Defendant in route, thought his P/S was scheduled for 4:45.  Court withdraws the authorized warrant.  P/S rescheduled to June 30, 2015 at 2:30 PM:

Case Called @ 3:50 PM: Attorney Paul Steven Screnock in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath admninistered at previous hearing today.  In light of nonappearance, Bench Warrant authorized.  Cash Bond of $250 is ordered forfeited.  Extradition within the State of Wisconsin.
To defendant regarding unsigned bond form
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Santos Vera in court with attorney Paul Steven Screnock.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.   Interpreter oath given by the Court.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Counsel to conduct an informal PTC prior to STC.   Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from Atty Screnock Re: Request to Adj 3/24/15 IA - Request granted by the Court.
